name: bentonite quarry operation | bentonite | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/5689/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of bentonite. Bentonite is an industrial mineral with a high content of swellable threelayer clay minerals, which often originates from the transformation of volcanic ashes and tuffs. Bentonite is used for the production of activated bentonite. This dataset is based on information published in an environmental report by a German company (Süd-Chemie AG).;References:;Kellenberger D., Althaus H.-J., Jungbluth N., Künniger T., Lehmann M. and Thalmann P. (2007) Life Cycle Inventories of Building Products. Final report ecoinvent Data v2.0 No. 7. EMPA Dübendorf, Swiss Centre for Life Cycle Inventories, Dübendorf, CH.;Virta R. L. (2015) USGS 2013 Minerals Yearbook – Clay and shale [advance release]

From the excavation of bentonite in the ground.

This activity ends with the production of bentonite. The dataset includes the excavation by digger, transportation to the first grinding machine, the land-use of the mine and the recultivation of the land.
category: B:Mining and quarrying/08:Other mining and quarrying/081:Quarrying of stone, sand and clay/0810:Quarrying of stone, sand and clay
tags: Sector: Resource Extraction; Minerals; Cement & Concrete

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: This dataset is based on data from a German company.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The technology used in the modelled German mine is probably state-of-art (first mining company in Europe taking part at an eco-audit based on EG-eco-audit requirements). The assumed thickness of the bentonite layer is 3 m. The thickness of overburden material is estimated to be 30 m. Digging and transportation is made by heavy diesel machines.;Reference:;Kellenberger D., Althaus H.-J., Jungbluth N., Künniger T., Lehmann M. and Thalmann P. (2007) Life Cycle Inventories of Building Products. Final report ecoinvent Data v2.0 No. 7. EMPA Dübendorf, Swiss Centre for Life Cycle Inventories, Dübendorf, CH.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: The data is based on an environmental report of one German company (Süd-Chemie AG).

exchanges.description:
Bentonite is an industrial mineral with a high content of swellable threelayer clay minerals, which often originates from the transformation of volcanic ashes and tuffs. Bentonite is used for the production of activated bentonite. 

References:
Kellenberger D., Althaus H.-J., Jungbluth N., Künniger T., Lehmann M. and Thalmann P. (2007) Life Cycle Inventories of Building Products. Final report ecoinvent Data v2.0 No. 7. EMPA Dübendorf, Swiss Centre for Life Cycle Inventories, Dübendorf, CH.
Virta R. L. (2015) USGS 2013 Minerals Yearbook – Clay and shale [advance release]

flow.name: bentonite
flow.category: B:Mining and quarrying/08:Other mining and quarrying/081:Quarrying of stone, sand and clay/0810:Quarrying of stone, sand and clay

exchanges.description:
Calculated value based on literature data (Süd-Chemie 1997). The volume of material extracted (including the overburden material and the bentonite) is 2.75 mio m3 per year. The average thickness of the overburden layer and bentonite layer is 33 m in total. Based on an annual production volume of bentonite of 380000 tonnes, the transformed land per kg of bentonite produced is 2.19E-4 m2.

Reference: 
Süd-Chemie (1997) Umwelterklärung Bentonit 1997, Standort Moosburg. Süd-Chemie AG, München und Moosburg, D-80333 München.

Literature data.

Reference:
Süd-Chemie (1999) vereinfachte Umwelterklärung Bentonit 1999, Standort Moosburg. Süd-Chemie AG, München und Moosburg, D-80333 München.

exchanges.description:
Calculated value. Based on Süd-Chemie (1997), the area of the mine was 247 ha in 1997, of which 233.1 ha was being used for storage, while 13.9 ha was being mined. Assuming that the total surface of the mine (247 ha) stays constant over time (meaning that a portion of the surface used is restored every year) and based on an average annual production volume of bentonite of 380000 tonnes, the land occupation is 0.0065 m2*year/kg bentonite.

Reference: 
Süd-Chemie (1997) Umwelterklärung Bentonit 1997, Standort Moosburg. Süd-Chemie AG, München und Moosburg, D-80333 München.

Literature data.

Reference:
Süd-Chemie (1999) vereinfachte Umwelterklärung Bentonit 1999, Standort Moosburg. Süd-Chemie AG, München und Moosburg, D-80333 München.
